Body: Description: AD Summary scan job is failing, please review the screenshots in the document. Thank you!

I'm thinking they just are using the wrong hostlists that has multiple dc's per domain.

That error itself isn't a problem as long as one of them from that domain is successfully scanning.

Probably worth reviewing the assigned host list. potentially make a custom one.
Invitation updated. Attendees: Scottie Taylor, Wajid Fazal
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed

Steps to Reproduce Updated: Step 1: Open the Netwrix Enterprise Auditor console.  
Step 2: Navigate to the AD Summary scan job.  
Step 3: Assign a host list that includes multiple domain controllers per domain.  
Step 4: Run the AD Summary scan job.  
Step 5: Observe the job failure and review the error messages generated.  

(Requested by user 0054u000007Mdqr)
What We've Learned Updated: Customer was a no call no show for our scheduled meeting today. 5/23/2025 3pm CT.

What We've Learned Updated: - The AD Summary scan job failure was caused by a record of a replaced domain controller (DC) using the same fully qualified domain name (FQDN), which was being picked up by the host discovery query.
- The issue was resolved by removing the DNS entry and FQDN associated with the replaced machine and its respective IP address, and modifying the host list to target the currently active domain controller.
- The customer indicated that the problem may have started after an Auditor upgrade, but no specific timeline or prior troubleshooting steps were provided.
- The customer did not attend the scheduled meeting on 5/23/2025, which delayed further investigation and resolution.
- The error messages generated during the scan job failure were linked to duplicate domain entries, as confirmed by the screenshots and logs provided.
- It remains unclear whether any other environmental changes besides the Auditor upgrade contributed to the issue.

(Requested by Scottie Taylor)

Next Steps Updated: No next steps documented.

(Requested by Scottie Taylor)
